questions.answer_description:
Box 1: New-CsGroupPolicyAssignment
Use the New-CsGroupPolicyAssignment cmdlet to assign a policy to a group.
Example: New-CsGroupPolicyAssignment -GroupId d8ebfa45-0f28-4d2d-9bcc-b158a49e2d17 -PolicyType TeamsMeetingPolicy -PolicyName "Retail Managers

Meeting Policy" -Rank 1 -

Box 2: TeamsAppsSetupPolicy -
Use app setup policies to install and pin apps to promote the most used apps in your organization, and to decide if you want users to upload custom apps to
Teams.
* Install apps: App setup policies let you install apps on behalf of users when they start Teams and during meetings.
* Pin apps.
* Upload custom apps.
Reference:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/assign-policies-users-and-groups https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/teams-app-setup-policies

questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft 365 subscription that uses Microsoft Teams.

The subscription is configured to display de-identified names in all reports.

You need to publish reports on the usage of teams in the subscription. The solution must include only reports that support de-identified names.

Which two reports can you use? Each correct answer presents a complete solution.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

You have a Microsoft 365 E5 subscription that uses Microsoft Teams.

You need to identify which percentage of meetings include video.

What should you use?

discussion.content: Correct, but now is called Microsoft Adoption Score

Selected Answer: B
B is correct. checked it in microsoft 365 admin center. You can find it under: https://admin.microsoft.com/#/adoptionscore/meetings
scroll down to something like "Meetings by type, with proven methods in Microsoft Teams"
There you have somethin like "using videos" with a graphic showing the amount and if you scroll over it the percentage as well

Selected Answer: D
the answer is D. when you run the report check the Video Time (minutes) Box on the column which will give you the result. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/teams-analytics-and-reports/user-activity-report

Selected Answer: B
The mentioned document confirms it is B.
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/admin/adoption/meetings?view=o365-worldwide

Selected Answer: B
The only report that has anything to do with meetings specific to video is the Adoption Score meeting insights, formerly known as Productivity Score. Tested in labs.

comments.content: Here is the MSFT Doc that supports this answer: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/admin/adoption/meetings?view=o365-worldwide

comments.content:
Nope, if the Teams client is set to send notifications through Windows 10's banners and you're not getting notifications, you have to fix/allow them in Windows 10, which would be using the posted answer, C

Doing what you're suggesting might also solve the issue, but it is not an answer option

choices.D: From the Microsoft Teams admin center, modify the Messaging policies settings.
choices.A: From the Settings app, modify the Focus assist settings.
choices.B: From the Microsoft Teams client change Teams and channels notifications to All activity.
choices.C: From the Settings app, modify the Notifications & actions settings.

What should you do to ensure that User1 receives Teams alerts?

comments.content: WRONG - owner is not able to modify sent messages whether they are theirs or someone elses! Can only delete as tested in Sandbox and two Teams desktop clients. The answers provided are correct. Stop upvoting this.
Be sure that your policy settings are already in place. No editing is possible for owner if policy is fully applied!

yes correct , Teams owner can delete and modify , just tested 
the provided answer for the second part is wrong

discussion.content: Testing this, appears that owners can delete and modify sent messages.

The answer is correct. Tested it on 7/7/21
Owners can only delete messages sent by other teams members but
can edit and delete their own messages.

Users: “cannot delete and modify” sent chat messages. This is because the settings indicate that users cannot delete or edit sent messages.

 Team owners: “can only delete” sent chat messages. This is because the settings indicate that team owners can delete sent messages.
team owners can delete sent messages but they cannot modify them. The ability to modify messages is turned off in the global messaging policy settings you’ve shown. If you want team owners to also be able to modify sent messages, you would need to change this setting in the Microsoft Teams admin center.
I take my comment back. Just tested and can delete but not modify (even as owner of the channel).
It seems implied that the person doing the action is the owner of the team, seeing that it says "Team Owners". Confusing indeed but my vote is they have delete and edit abilities.

According to MS article it is not about whether owners can delete their own sent messages, but users' sent messages. In this case I believe it should be "Only delete" since modifying other people messages is not an option. See below: 

Owners can delete sent messages: Use this setting to let owners delete channel messages or posts that users sent.

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/messaging-policies-in-teams
Was on exam 19.08.2022
owner can only delete no edit option is available once the policy is applied. you actually have to refresh your teams client for the policy to apply
Owners can delete and modify, in exam on 25th of June 2022

This is somewhat confusing
Owners can delete and modify only their own messages
On exam 04-Mar-2022
I had this question 26/02/2022
Answer is correct. Tested on 10.05.2021. No Edit only Delete available in ... menu
